item.title: All NASA News - NASA
item.description: Stay up-to-date with the latest content from NASA as we explore the universe and discover more about our home planet.

item.title: NASA Welcomes Oman as Newest Artemis Accords Signatory - NASA
item.description: The Sultanate of Oman signed the Artemis Accords during a ceremony in Muscat attended by NASA on Monday, becoming the 61st nation to commit to responsible

item.title: NASA Technology Brings Golden Age of Exploration to Earth - NASA
item.description: As NASA fosters technologies needed to live and work farther away from home than ever before, the agency’s Technology Transfer program has the sole mission of

item.title: 2026 News Releases - NASA
item.description: Sign up to receive NASA news releases and other information.

item.title: Crew Studies Robotics and Virtual Reality Advancing Space Tech - NASA
item.description: Robotics and virtual reality filled the science schedule aboard the International Space Station on Tuesday as the Expedition 74 crew promoted education and explored human research. The orbital trio also inspected safety equipment, worked on cargo swaps, and conducted Earth observations.

item.title: Space Physics, Cardiac Research Kickoff Last Week in January - NASA
item.description: Space physics and cardiac research kicked off the week aboard the International Space Station for the three-person Expedition 74 crew. The orbital residents explored storing cryogenic fluids in space and how their cardiovascular system is adapting to weightlessness.

item.title: NASA’s Juno Measures Thickness of Europa’s Ice Shell
item.description: Results from the solar-powered spacecraft provide a new measurement of the thickness of the ice shell encasing the Jovian moon’s ocean.

item.title: How NASA Is Homing in From Space on Ocean Debris
item.description: Space-based technology could help track plastic and other flotsam by its ‘fingerprints.’

item.title: NASA Reveals New Details About Dark Matter’s Influence on Universe
item.description: With the Webb telescope’s unprecedented sensitivity, scientists are learning more about dark matter’s influence on stars, galaxies, and even planets like Earth.

item.title: NASA’s SunRISE SmallSats Ace Tests, Moving Closer to Launch
item.description: The small satellites passed a crucible of tests, ending with a simulation of the intense vibrations of launch.

item.title: NASA’s SPHEREx Observatory Completes First Cosmic Map Like No Other
item.description: The telescope will help scientists answer big-picture questions about everything from water deposits in the Milky Way to what happened in the first second after the big bang.

item.title: NASA’s Perseverance Mars Rover Ready to Roll for Miles in Years Ahead
item.description: The rover has been acing a long-term series of durability tests, making the most of its enhanced navigation capabilities, and ferreting out new findings about Mars’ geologic past.

item.title: NASA Study Suggests Saturn’s Moon Titan May Not Have Global Ocean
item.description: Reanalysis of data from NASA’s Cassini mission has revealed Saturn’s moon may instead have layers of slush with isolated pockets of liquid water.

item.title: NASA JPL Shakes Things Up Testing Future Commercial Lunar Spacecraft
item.description: As Firefly Aerospace prepares to follow its successful soft landing on the Moon, an engineering model for its next lander is being put through its paces.

item.title: NASA, SpaceX Launch US-European Satellite to Monitor Earth’s Oceans
item.description: Sentinel-6B will extend a decades-long legacy of global sea level measurements that help forecast weather, protect coastal communities, and more.

item.description: Throughout November, the Terran R program made key advancements across design, build, test, and launch operations. item.description: New contract adds launch services for SES’s GEO or MEO satellites
